intro: Veratrum eschscholtzii, commonly known as the western white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces large, showy white to pale blue flowers arranged in clusters at the top of the stem. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its roots contain toxic alkaloids. This plant is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
